title: Business Live: Sterling rises - BBC News
summary: tesco shares fall despite higher sales and profits .
yahoo admits 3bn accounts breached in cyber attack .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's all from the business live page for tonight .
please join us again tomorrow from 06:00am onwards .

documents.title: us markets close higher
text: the dow jones industrial average closed 19.21 points higher at 22,660.88 .
the s & p 500 finished up 3.15 points at 2,537.72 .
the nasdaq ended 2.91 points at 6,534.63 .

documents.title: solar soars
text: solar power grew faster than any other source of fuel for the first time in 2016 .
and renewables accounted for almost two-thirds of net new power capacity around the world .
that 's according to an international energy agency report .
solar , powered by photovoltaics , grew by 50 percent , with almost half of new plants built in china it said .
what we are witnessing is the birth of a new era in solar pv , '' said fatih birol , executive director of the iea ,
we expect that solar pv capacity growth will be higher than any other renewable technology through 2022 . ''

documents.title: 'not scared of the dark '
text: one of the winners of the nobel prize for chemistry announced earlier today has a endearing approach to writing a resume , as online news site quartz spotted .
jacques dubochet 's c.v. is full of quirky personal details like `` 1994 : no longer scared of the dark , because the sun comes back ; it was copernicus who explained this . ''
that and all the clever electron microscopy of course as well .

documents.title: greg clarke on the industrial strategy
text: greg clarke on the industrial strategy

documents.title: car finance not a cause for concern 'per se ' says regulator
text: the uk 's chief financial regulator has downplayed concerns over households ' increased use of car loans .
the bank of england has previously warned that a rise in personal loans , including car finance products , could contribute to financial instability .
but andrew bailey , head of the financial conduct authority , said car loans were not `` per se bad '' .
however , overall levels of consumer indebtedness were worrying , he said .
read more here .

documents.title: bank of england says brexit transition deal needed by christmas
text: uk banks need a watertight brexit transition deal by christmas to avoid a potentially disorderly shift of people and operations to the european union , a top bank of england official says .

boe deputy governor sam woods said that while the british government wants a deal to bridge leaving the eu in march 2019 and the start of new trading terms , the eu 's position was still unclear and the clock was ticking .

`` if we get to christmas and the negotiations have not reached any agreement on this to diminishing marginal returns will kick in , '' mr woods told the annual city banquet in london 's `` square mile '' financial district .

documents.title: british gas owner : 'price caps are wrong '
text: following theresa may 's announcement of an energy price cap , iain conn , group chief executive of british gas owner centrica said :
we have heard the prime minister 's speech and will wait to see what the draft bill actually says
we agree that some further structural change is required .
however , we have also been clear that price caps are the wrong solution .
`` there is clear evidence that where they have been tried , they have been bad for customers .
they limit choice , reduce competition , and prices tend to cluster around the cap . ''
`` the main problem with the market is the standard variable tariff .
rather than cap them , which will keep standard tariffs going , our position has been that they should come to an end . ''

documents.title: moneysavingexpert 's lewis : 'winter is coming '
text: earlier , prime minister theresa may announced of a draft bill which would give ofgem power to impose a temporary energy price cap .
martin lewis , founder of moneysavingexpert.com , says :
it 's a national disgrace that a struggling 90 year-old granny pays substantially more to boil a kettle than an affluent web-savvy man like me
yet imposing a cap will take at least a year to come in , and to channel game of thrones , winter is coming .
right now someone on a big 6 standard tariff with ty usage pays £ 1,130 per year on average , the cheapest tariffs are £ 820 per year - same gas , same electricity , same safety .
`` so no-one should wait for the cap .
everyone should check if they 're on the best deal now too many already choose between heating and eating . ''

documents.title: wall street climbs after tillerson denies mulling resignation
text: wall street has hit new record highs after us secretary of state rex tillerson denied reports that he considered resigning in the summer .
the s & p 500 and the nasdaq reversed early losses following mr tillerson 's comments , while the dow extended gains .
however , mr tillerson declined to directly address whether he had referred to the president as a `` moron '' , as nbc news has reported .

documents.title: soul-searching in washington after equifax
text: the massive hack at equifax , in which hackers stole information from `` potentially '' 145.5 million americans , is causing some soul-searching in washington .
the us has taken a relatively lax approach to digital privacy historically , with lawmakers hesitant to regulate dynamic internet industries .

but during a second day of hearings about the equifax breach , republicans and democrats in the senate said the incident illustrates the need to take a broader look at the rules governing data collection - not just in the credit industry , but in others as well .

`` as congress looks at this issue it seems to me that it should be obvious that we should look much more broadly to the data collection that is going on across our society , '' said senator mike crapo , republican of idaho .
author: Natalie Sherman
New York business reporter

documents.title: uk 'could lose 67bn euro data market '
text: the uk could lose out to the tune of 67bn euros ( £ 60bn ) per year if the government gets brexit negotiations over data-market access wrong , a government-funded digital innovation group has warned .

bloomberg reports that the uk has the largest market for information - from retail data to mobile phone location data - but if this data ca n't flow freely between the eu and the uk , the uk could lose its market dominance , digital catapult warns .

documents.title: uswitch boss : 'price cap not the answer '
text: richard neudegg , head of regulation at uswitch , says :
`` we have warned repeatedly that a widespread price cap will not improve the retail energy market as some think it will .
all the evidence from previous interventions like this shows that it does not lead to long-term improvements for consumers .
`` any government intervention must commit to helping competition work for everyone .
the only way to keep energy companies in check is to maintain the pressure of competition on them to keep prices down for all their customers .
the government should instead push suppliers to proactively get their customers off expensive standard tariffs and set targets to encourage more customers to make a choice about their energy deal .
`` a price cap condemns energy customers to more of the same - it lets suppliers off the hook by encouraging consumers to stay put instead of voting with their feet . ''

documents.title: 'why cap it when you can scrap it ? '
text: e.on has restated that from early 2018 its standard variable tariff will no longer be the default option for people coming to the end of an existing tariff .
michael lewis , chief executive of e.on uk says :
`` as we have made clear , we believe for all customers standard variable tariffs have had their day therefore the question is : 'why cap it when you can scrap it ? '

`` we will of course also look at the detail behind the comments made by the prime minister today but remain utterly convinced that increased engagement in the energy market is the best way forward for all customers and changes to make this a reality are already happening . ''

documents.title: energy firms weigh on ftse
text: energy firms centrica and sse dragged on the uk 's main share index after prime minister theresa may announced plans to cap energy prices .
the ftse 100 closed flat as british gas owner centrica sank 6 % , while sse was down more than 3 % .

documents.title: epa 'to propose repealing obama climate regulation '
text: the us environmental protection agency ( epa ) will propose repealing the clean power plan - the obama administration 's main regulation to fight climate change - and plans to consult on a rule to replace it , news agency reuters reports .
donald trump has expressed doubts about climate change , and installed scott pruitt ( who has close links to fossil fuel interests , as head of the epa in february .

documents.title: energy uk boss - 'you can save £ 100 in minutes '
text: the boss of industry body energy uk , lawrence slade , says this about the government 's energy price cap plans :

the energy market is changing at a rapid pace - there are now over 50 suppliers to choose from and the energy switch guarantee , launched by the industry , means it is simple , speedy and safe to switch , with many customers able to save much more than £ 100 in minutes by checking their tariff .
over 3 million consumers have switched already this year and the number of standard tariffs have fallen by almost a million in the last six months .
`` it is important that we do not risk halting this growth of competition and engagement in the market . ''

documents.title: court rejects newcastle united 's legal challenge to tax raids
text: newcastle united has lost a high court challenge over document seizures by tax officials investigating the finances of soccer clubs .
`` we are disappointed with this decision given the court 's findings , '' nufc said .
`` we are considering all of our options with our advisers , including whether to pursue an appeal . ''

her majesty 's revenue and customes ( hmrc ) said : `` hmrc is pleased that the court agreed these warrants were lawful and justified in this case , and rejected each of the five grounds for which the review was sought .
`` our investigation into suspected tax fraud continues .
we do not comment on individual cases or ongoing investigations . ''
hmrc officials raided newcastle united and west ham football clubs in april , with several men arrested for suspected income tax and national insurance fraud .

the hmrc said at the time that french authorities were assisting their efforts and searches had been carried out in france in connection with the investigation , which centres around transfer deals between english and french clubs .

documents.title: energy price cap 'to be temporary '
text: the department of business , energy and industry strategy ( beis ) says the energy price cap , to be set by ofgem , will be temporary .

`` the draft [ energy cap ] bill will provide for a safeguard tariff to be set by ofgem , having regard to the need to protect consumers and maintain incentives for switching , and for suppliers to innovate , compete and finance their business .
`` ofgem would consult on how the cap will operate .
the safeguard tariff would be a temporary measure and the need for it would be kept under review , with a backstop date set for removal of the cap .
`` the draft bill will be published for pre-legislative scrutiny , '' it added
the safeguard tariff would apply to households on standard variable tariffs , which currently number 12 million ( excluding prepayment meters )
the government 's new energy price cap , called a `` safeguard tariff '' , would be temporary with a backstop date set for removal

documents.title: ofgem 'will work with government ' on price cap
text: the energy regulator says it will work with the government on its energy cap :
ofgem 's number one priority is to protect consumers .

`` we share the government 's concern that the market is not working for all consumers , especially the vulnerable , and will work with the government on their plans announced today to better protect consumers on poor value deals . ''

documents.title: number 10 on energy cap
text: downing street says the energy cap announced by theresa may will apply to all standard variable rates .
the government has written to the regulator ofgem and is waiting for a reply but ministers `` want to show a real declaration of intent '' , a spokesman says .
a draft bill has been written and the legislative process will begin next week .
asked what the government would do if ofgem responded with a proposal the spokesman said they 'd consider it `` if the destination is the same and ofgem can do it more quickly . ''

documents.title: how much would a price cap cost centrica ?
text: neil wilson , market analyst at etx capital writes :
`` it [ the price cap ] might cost centrica something like £ 200m and make it much tougher for the firm to reintroduce the progressive dividend policy .
`` like other providers it relies heavily on these standard variable rate tariffs - about three-quarters of customers are on these lucrative contracts .
`` what we do n't know is the extent of the cap - will it exceed ofgem 's plans to cap prices for vulnerable customers .

`` a wider cap is not something that will go down well with many of the many true free market conservatives - her defence of free market capitalism does not extend to energy providers - but there is a real urgency for may to be seen to be doing more for struggling households .

documents.title: centrica sags
text: reuters economics correspondent andy bruce tweets :
centrica shares now lowest since jan 2004 on may 's speech

documents.title: cap to hit standard variable tariffs
text: a price cap on the uk energy market would apply to all standard variable tariffs , theresa may 's office said on wednesday , in a move that could lower prices for millions of households .
the prime minister told the conservative party conference she would introduce a draft bill to impose new legislation next week .

the government had already asked the regulator , ofgem , to look at suggestions to improve the running of the market , and her spokesman later said it may not need legislation to introduce a bill if ofgem is able to act quickly enough .

documents.title: carney comments 'aimed at propping up sterling '
text: there was a growing consensus that uk interest rates could start to rise this year and possibly next month .
recent comments from bank of england governor mark carney seemed to support that view .
the credit rating agency s & p says it 's hard to justify a rate rise and thinks it may not happen at all .
`` we believe the bank and mark carney 's recent statements are primarily aimed at propping up sterling to reduce imported inflation pressures .
`` this strategy may include an actual 25 basis point hike in november , thus bringing the policy rate back to where it was before the brexit referendum .
additional moves in 2018 do not appear warranted on the back of a slowing economy . ''
the pound today is 0.3 % higher against the dollar at $ 1.3282 and flat against the euro at €1.1278 .

documents.title: breakingunite to sue over monarch jobs
text: unite said it will take legal action on behalf of more than 1,800 workers who lost their jobs when monarch airlines collapsed on monday .

the union said it would lodge employment tribunal proceedings over the company 's failure to consult the workers on redundancies , and said the employers had not given the necessary notice or statutory pay .

`` unite is doing everything it can to assist former monarch workers in securing new jobs , offering free legal advice and launching legal action to secure the compensation they are owed , as well as helping members find jobs with other airlines , '' unite national officer oliver richardson said .
`` the manner in which monarch went into administration and the way the government allowed it happen means there is a strong claim for compensation by former monarch workers . ''

documents.title: who said what
text: politico 's ryan heath tweets :
in one place : what @ twitterid @ twitterid and luxembourg say on eu 's tax ruling

documents.title: breaking'extremely disappointing '
text: ireland says it is `` extremely disappointing '' that the european commission has taken action against it at this time .
the irish government said it remained fully committed to ensuring that recovery of alleged state aid takes place .

documents.title: ireland under fire over €13bn apple tax bill
text: more news from the european commission : it is taking ireland to the european court of justice for its failure to recover up to €13bn of tax due from apple .

the ec ordered the us company in august 2016 to pay the unpaid tax as it ruled the firm had received illegal state aid - one of a number of deals the eu has targeted between multinationals and usually smaller eu states .
`` more than one year after the commission adopted this decision , ireland has still not recovered the money , also not in part , '' eu competition commissioner margrethe vestager said .
`` we of course understand that recovery in certain cases may be more complex than in others , and we are always ready to assist .
but member states need to make sufficient progress to restore competition , '' she added .
the deadline for ireland to implement its decision had been 3 january and that , until the aid was recovered , the company continued to benefit from an illegal advantage .

documents.title: breakingamazon told to repay €250m tax
text: brussels has ordered amazon to repay about €250m in taxes to luxembourg , saying it had been given an unfair tax advantage from 2003 .
`` luxembourg gave illegal tax benefits to amazon .
as a result , almost three quarters of amazon 's profits were not taxed , '' competition commissioner margrethe vestager said .
the €250m is less than an estimate of €400m last year .
amazon is the latest big us company to be reined in by the eu competition regulator , which also told technology group apple pay back up to €13bn .

documents.title: please sir , can i have some more ?
text: rejoice !
lord sugar is back on bbc one tonight with a new series of the apprentice .
in a bid to drum up some much-needed publicity for the show , he says women should push for higher pay if they earn less than men .
yes , the gender pay gap `` can be narrowed by the lady herself saying , 'no , i want more money ' '' , according to the life peer .
glad we 've sorted that out then .

documents.title: nissan shares skid
text: shares in nissan lost ground following reports in japan that the car maker had routinely forged final inspection documents for new vehicles .
it comes after the company said earlier this week it would recall 1.2m cars in japan which had not received proper safety checks .
the 1.2 % drop for nissan came as the nikkei 225 index , which is sitting at a two-year high , added 12 points to close at 20,626.6 .
hong kong 's hang seng moved 0.7 % higher in afternoon trading , while south korea was closed for a holiday .
losses for energy shares weighed on australia 's market , sending the asx 200 down 0.9 % , or 49 points , to 5,652 .

documents.title: 'stuck in a rut '
text: samuel tombs at pantheon macroeconomics says the uk services sector remains `` stuck in a rut '' , casting doubt over whether the monetary policy committee will press ahead with a rate rise over the coming months '' .

he adds : `` the mpc emphasised last month that a rate rise was not guaranteed , but was contingent on 'the economy continuing to follow a path consistent with the prospect of a continued erosion of slack ' .
`` the latest pmis - especially the decline in their forward-looking balances - do not warrant such optimism .
as such , we continue to think that markets have gone too far in pricing-in a 75 % chance of a november rate rise . ''

documents.title: facebook pays £ 5.1m in uk tax
text: tech correspondent rory cellan-jones tweets :
facebook uk accounts for 2016 just published - paid corporation tax of £ 5.1m ( up from £ 4.2m ) on profits of £ 58m , revenues £ 842m
that tax bill presumably comes from carried forward losses ?
less than 9 % of a creative £ 58m profit

documents.title: 'lacklustre '
text: ey item club 's howard archer tweets :
# pmi shows # uk # services activity improved modestly in sep but lacklustre ; index up to 53.6 from aug 11-month low of 53.2 ;

documents.title: pound moves higher after services data
text: the pound perked up a bit after the latest data on the uk service sector .
it rose by around of a quarter of a cent to trade at $ 1.3274 .

`` the latest survey on the services sector has come in better than expected taking the edge off of some disappointing data releases for the uk economy in the past couple of days , '' said david cheetham from xtb.com

documents.title: tesco shares reverse
text: funny the difference an hour can make .
after initially rising about 2 % , tesco shares have now fallen about 1.8 % .

laith khalaf at hargreaves lansdown adds : `` short-term market movements show little respect for fundamental business performance , and that 's evident in tesco 's falling share price despite the supermarket putting out some good numbers this morning .

`` i suspect the negative market reaction is a result of slipping sales performance in the uk , though in any set of company results there are always negatives the market can dwell on , and that applies in spades for a company like tesco which is in the process of recovering to full health . ''

documents.title: breakinguk service sector jumps
text: the services pmi rose to 53.6 in september - slightly better than expectations to hold steady at august 's level of 53.2 .

documents.title: italy 's service sector lags rest of europe
text: most european economies continue to show signs of health , according the results from suveys of purchasing managers ( pmis ) conducted by ihs/markit .
growth in germany 's services sector accelerated to a six-month high in september .
france saw a jump in the service pmi index .
activity in spain 's service sector also accelerated , with the report indicating that new business was being generated at the fastest rate in two years .
however , italy saw service sector activity slow for the second month running .

documents.title: kpmg woes continue
text: more bad news for kpmg from south africa today .
the university of the witwatersrand is dropping the firm as its auditor in the wake of a scandal about its work for the gupta family .

`` it was agreed that kpmg had not been sufficiently transparent and that it is hard to reconcile kpmg 's conclusion that no one did anything illegal when senior individuals have been dismissed , '' vice-chancellor adam habib said .
kpmg has admitted that its work for the guptas , who have close links to president jacob zuma , `` fell short of our standards '' .

documents.title: 888 holdings biggest shareholder selling out
text: so why are shares in online gaming company 888 holdings down so much this morning ?
well , its biggest shareholder the o shaked shares trust , has sold its entire shareholding , which represents a 12 % stake in the firm .
o shaked received 243p per share and raised £ 112m .
888 holdings shares are trading 4.6 % lower at 247p .
the company describes itself as the `` world 's most popular online gaming entertainment and solution providers '' .

documents.title: 23,000 monarch passengers returned
text: more than a fifth of monarch passengers who were abroad when the airline collapsed have returned to the uk since the repatriation operation started on monday .
the civil aviation authority ( caa ) said that 119 flights had brought back 23,321 people , with another 11,091 expected to return on wednesday .
the remaining 87,431 monarch airlines customers are expected to be back in the uk by october 15 , at no extra cost .
the caa 's richard moriarty says : `` flight details for people due to travel back to the uk on 5 october are already published on monarch.caa.co.uk .
we have everyone 's original flight details and our plan is to publish new flight details as soon as possible , normally 24 hours in advance of travel . ''

documents.title: ftse 100 moves higher
text: the ftse 100 has started the day in positive territory .
tesco is the biggest winner , up 1.7 % after its solid first-half year results .
standard life aberdeen is the biggest loser with a 2 % fall .
on the ftse 250 there are hefty falls for provident financial and 888 holdings , both down 5 % .

documents.title: 'impressive '
text: laith khalaf , senior analyst at hargreaves lansdown , comments :

`` there 's not many things more telling about the health of company than its ability to pay a dividend , and tesco 's return to the register after a three year hiatus speaks volumes about the progress the company has made .
it 's only a small amount , but this token payment is symbolic in nature .
`` what 's particularly impressive is that tesco has delivered such strong performance against a challenging backdrop .
consumer purses are under pressure and the costs of imported goods have risen , while at the same time there is no shortage of competitors vying for the business of uk shoppers .
tesco has done well to keep food price inflation down for its customers , while also improving its operating margin . ''

documents.title: end of the line
text: 5 live presenter sean farrington tweets :
final day you 'll be able to spend your £ 1 coins is october 15th .
( i 've been very confused by all legal tender `` from '' s and `` to '' s , myself )
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: 'new era ' for solar
text: the world is witnessing `` the birth of a new era '' in solar power , with growth faster than any other fuel in 2016 , the international energy agency said .
the amount of new solar photovoltaics ( pv ) outstripped the net increase in coal power in 2016 , according to the agency 's latest renewables market analysis .
overall , renewables - mostly wind and solar - accounted for almost two-thirds of new power installed globally in 2016 .
by 2022 , the amount of solar that has been installed globally will exceed the combined total electricity capacity of india and japan today .

although coal will globally still be the largest source of electricity in 2022 , renewables will have halved the gap in just five years and will eventually become the biggest power source worldwide , the study said .
fatih birol , iea chief , said : `` what we are witnessing is the birth of a new era in solar pv .
we expect that solar pv capacity growth will be higher than any other renewable technology through 2022 . ''

documents.title: topps down
text: it could have been worse : shares in topps tiles are down about 5 % after its suggestion that profits will be disappointing .
the stock was as much as 9 % lower just a couple of minutes ago .

documents.title: tesco absorbing inflation
text: `` inflation in the market is somewhere between 2.6 % and 3.2 % , depending on which categories you are looking at and we have been 1 % below that , '' tesco chief executive dave lewis tells the bbc .
he says input costs are rising due to changes in exchange rates .
to compensate for that tesco has been reducing costs and working with suppliers .

documents.title: tesco shares rise
text: shares in tesco have risen 2 % as trading gets underway in london .
the stock is still down 6 % for the year to date , but is 6 % higher over the past 12 months .
britain 's biggest retailer is worth £ 15.8bn , by the way .

documents.title: green 'optimistic ' on brexit deal
text: britain is getting ready for leaving the european union without a deal by making contingency plans , but a so-called `` no deal '' is very unlikely , first secretary of state damian green said .

green , effectively theresa may 's deputy , said that after mrs may made her speech in florence last month he was more confident of moving the negotiations on to their second phase , to tackle a future trade deal .

`` first of all , of course we want there to be a deal and i am optimistic there is clearly a possibility that there will be no deal and whitehall is making contingency plans for that i think that 's unlikely , very unlikely , '' he told itv at the conservative party conference in manchester .

documents.title: breakingtopps tiles warning
text: topps tiles says that despite a moderate improvement in trading in our final quarter , `` market conditions remain challenging '' .
the retailer now expects adjusted pre-tax profits for the year to september will be at the `` lower end of the current range of market expectations '' .
as that counts as a profit warning , watch the shares slide in 10 minutes or so when the london market opens .

documents.title: tesco boss 'shocked ' at chicken plant report
text: dave lewis tells journalists that he was `` as shocked as anybody '' when reports emerged of food safety breaches at one of its suppliers of chicken - the 2 sisters food group .
however , he said that tesco executives and food safety officials visited the plant on friday and did not find any issues .
the plant has suspended operations while it retrains staff .
the 2 sisters food group supplies chicken for tesco 's willow farms brand .
mr lewis is backing the brand saying it has been extremely popular .

documents.title: tesco to make £ 1.5bn
text: tesco chief executive dave lewis says he is `` very comfortable '' with analyst expectations that the company will make £ 1.5bn this year .

documents.title: in full swing
text: the times retail editor deirdre hipwell tweets :
in a sign tesco 's turnaround really is in full flow , tesco 's profits in the uk and ireland business up 21 per cent at £ 471 million .

documents.title: dave lewis delivers
text: bruno monteyne , an analyst at sanford c. bernstein , tells today that tesco is recovering in the uk , while its troubled international operations are also improving .
`` total scorecard : dave lewis is really delivering , '' he says .
improved pricing and service , along with simplified ranges , have brought customers back , allowing tesco to cut costs , according to mr monteyne .
although the restored dividend is modest , he says it sends an important signal and is a `` sign of confidence '' from management about tesco 's prospects .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: tesco boosted by fresh food and clothing sales
text: dave lewis tells journalists on a conference call that fresh food did particularly well in the first half of the year .
its bakery served up 4 % sales growth , while meat sales were up 6 % .
however , clothing also did well , with sales up 3.5 % .
mr lewis also said that tesco 's inflation rate is 1 % lower than its peers .

documents.title: sales and margins rise
text: more on tesco : group sales rose 3.3 % to £ 25.2bn for the half year , while group operating margin rose from 2.2 % to 2.7 % .
the supermarket says it is on track for 3.5 to 4 % .
the company also says it has further simplified its pricing , reducing the number of multi-buy promotions by 10 % year-on-year .

documents.title: tesco dividend returns
text: tesco is also reinstating the interim dividend - a modest 1p - after a three-year hiatus .

chief executive dave lewis says the dividend move `` reflects our confidence that we can build on our strong performance to date and in doing so , create long-term , sustainable value for all of our stakeholders '' .

he adds : `` sales are up , profits are up , cash generation continues to strengthen and net debt levels are less than half what they were when we started our turnaround three years ago our offer is more competitive and more customers are shopping at tesco . ''

ah , well the land thing , if they went ahead it would be under a special class as it 's in the `` national interest '' they could override
planning restrictions on land previously blocked , it green belt etc .
that would then set a precedent for other builders .
they did this
before in other areas , say x houses with y affordable/social to get permission then drop cheaper ones after building done .
a total scam .
like battersea power station build .
1st affordable housing could n't be built on site planned .
2nd they could n't build as many as planned
property builders wriggled out of agreements and council let them .
jc is running the country .
deliberately blurring ha and local authorities .
centrally controlled housing not council housing .
who is going to build them ?
commercial developers will not want to .
contractors are going full pace at the moment .
brexit will limit our ability to recruit workers from abroad .
it 's a good policy but with little practical basis .
and people say labour did n't win the general election .
they may not be in government but they are in power .
hope it is a fully costed , fully planned announcement with finite timeliness .
however , in reality this will be forgotten about by next month
what she 's not announcing is the continuation of austerity and cynical underfunding of the nhs .
nhs is used and abused not underfunded .
i work there

documents.title: business pages : monarch ; uber ; betting
text: the business section of the times reports that monarch may have been able to survive , if british aviation law had not prevented it from operating while under administration .
the article points out that every leading us airline has operated under chapter 11 of the us bankruptcy code .
transport for london ( tfl ) has said it will take weeks for uber to win back its trust , reports the daily telegraph .
the chief executive of uber and tfl have been holding talks , after tfl denied uber a new operating licence .
the guardian reports that betting shop staff are not properly trained to spot problem gamblers and some are even encouraging customer to chase losses .
the article quotes a report from the industry group for responsible gambling .

documents.title: will they or wo n't they ?
text: guess what the best-performing g10 currency in september was ?
that 's right : the plucky british pound !

jane foley of rabobank tells today that sterling was coming from a weak base - but she atrributes its performance to the more hawkish commentary coming out of the bank of england about interest rates .
while many believe that the bank will raise rates in november , she says governor mark carney could be accused yet again of acting like an `` unreliable boyfriend '' if it does not .

yesterday 's wobbly construction figures were a shock , ms foley says , and if today 's services data and new car registration figures are also weak , it will be very difficult for the bank to hike '' this year , mr foley argues .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: uber declares peace
text: uber 's fractured board has attempted to put months of strife behind it by unanimously passing a series of measures to shore up corporate governance , bring in major investor softbank and diminish the power of former chief executive travis kalanick .
the agreement could shore up uber 's reputation after a series of scandals and a legal battle between mr kalanick and an uber investor group led by silicon valley 's benchmark capital .
the deal could be subject to a lawsuit and is contingent on the multi-billion dollar investment by japan 's softbank closing in the coming weeks .
the terms preserve uber 's huge $ 69bn ( £ 52bn ) valuation as softbank and others invest about $ 10bn .
`` softbank 's interest is an incredible vote of confidence in uber 's business and long-term potential , '' the board said in a statement .

documents.title: amazon faces huge tax bill
text: the european union is expected to order amazon to pay back hundreds of millions of euros in back taxes .
how is this being viewed in the united states ?
technology analyst rob enderle says that it depends on who you speak to .
on the record , people will say it 's a political game with both the us and the european union trying to prise money out of the big technology firms .
off the record , some will say that the big firms `` had this coming '' and that sooner or later loopholes were going to be closed and the firms would be punished .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: 'business has to get off its posterior '
text: john longworth the former director general of the british chambers of commerce and prominent leave campaigner , is frustrated with big businesses for not investing and blaming uncertainty over brexit .
`` business does have to get off its posterior .
`` it 's the big corporates and multi-nationals in particular that are hesitating , they seem to want the nanny state because they are not very enterprising .
however , he adds :
`` it 's also incumbent on the government to give business some certainty .
`` this side of christmas the government has to paint a of what the post-brexit economic will be and it has to be a positive
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: tesco results : investors 'optimistic '
text: jane foley , senior currency strategist , rabobank
`` profits are expected to be ok in fact the markets is expecting sales to - quite a healthy
she says that one of the reasons that investors are optimistic about tesco is that rival aldi was showing signs of struggling .
tesco has been able to keep prices low and market share , says ms foley .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to wednesday 's business live page .
tesco reports interim results at 07:00 , meanwhile a fraud trial of three former senior executives continues .
amazon is facing a huge bill for back taxes , we are expecting to hear further details from european union authorities later .
and yahoo has said that all of its three billion user accounts were affected in a hacking attack back in 2013 .
author: Ben Morris
Business reporter
